body_html:
Thanks for the reply! Even though using a list comprehension is a tad bit nicer, I still believe having to do the filtering by yourself is unnecessary.

As for your question, when I try to initialize (in this case) Adam without this filtering, I get a ValueError:

pytorch/torch/optim/optimizer.py

Line 193 in 4c51107

raise ValueError("optimizing a parameter that doesn't require gradients")

System Info

PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: No

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609

body:
Thanks for the reply! Even though using a list comprehension is a tad bit nicer, I still believe having to do the filtering by yourself is unnecessary.

As for your question, when I try to initialize (in this case) `Adam` without this filtering, I get a `ValueError`:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/4c511075c3782e96d49f16a32344a1aba3c0fd8f/torch/optim/optimizer.py#L193

## System Info

Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 8.0.61

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609
